title: You are ineligible to earn loot due to previous behavioral restrictions.
body: Sooo does this mean I'll never be able to earn hextech stuff due to chat restrictions in past?

replies.body:
I was chat restricted recently.. I had a couple really crappy days, and raged at a couple of trolls.. Yes... I messed up and fed the trolls. I will tell you right now.. Bronze life is tough. I would like to see the stats on the average rank/tier of those punished.. I guarantee most of us are Bronze.. People down here just don't give a #### and it is really hard not to fire back sometimes when you are baited and trolled. I dealt with my 10 game chat restriction and as far as I can remember haven't had any issues since. Because of this, I can't participate in hextech crafting.. despite the fact that I have played since S1, have all but 11 champs and have over 1000 positive notes on my account between "Friendly/Helpful/Teamwork/Honorable Opponent".... They chat restricted me for 4 bad games over a 3 day period that I probably played 20-30 games and probably got trolled about 10-15 times and blew up in 4 of them.

What about the 1000+ positive comments.. do they weigh nothing? What about the hundreds of dollars and thousands of hours.. nothing? What about the hundreds of Tribunal cases I have reviewed? Yup... still nothing. I was negative in 4 games.. so I don't deserve any hextech loot... 

The worst part of it? Not only do I not get loot.. I get slapped in the face EVERY game over it when the "You are ineligible to earn loot due to previous behavior problems". It is honestly making me frustrated enough to revert to toxicity.. Why should I give a "F" about what I say if I am not gonna earn loot either way.. I have played since S1.. most days it is not hard to walk the line between jerk and reportable jerk if I so choose.. It is also even easier to be normal, nice, and supportive. However, the problem with me is that I have an "F me? F YOU!" attitude and disposition.. And right now.. Riot has decided to "F" me.. so I guess I will just play with an "F" it attitude for now.
Stay strong, I have a feeling this might have been a mistake by riot, based off my interpretation of their FAQ

But also - please keep in mind that the people you are playing the game with are not the people that are "f-ing" you. They are random people, some of them probably getting shafted just like you are. They don't make the game, they don't balance the game, they didn't make hextech crates. So before you get toxic with players and rage at them just remember that it's not like it makes the game any better.  It makes whoever you bullied rage in their next game. If you really want to shove it in Riot's face send them a review ticket or something. Uninstall.  Stop buying their skins (whatever it is you feel like doin lol).  But don't make other people miserable because a company doesn't have their shit together.

replies.body: Welp.. time to just create a new account, I guess me doing my time for my punishments and reforming meant nothing.

Riot loves to enforce ex post facto justice.  I remember commenting on something about season rewards for season 4, how they instated a reward for never getting chat restricted all season.  They announced this a few months before the end of the season I believe.  You would think that everyone would have a clean slate from that moment and violaters after the announcement would be punished accordingly and everyone would be entitled to the reward they just found out about. Instead, anybody who received a chat restriction or greater would get no rewards outright.

To put that in perspective, you download a movie (for instance).  There is no legislation about that certain type of downloading being piracy or otherwise.  One day, a law is passed calling that way of downloading piracy.  Because you downloaded before that date, you are exempt from prosecution due to ex post facto law.  This is pretty common practice in most governing bodies, so I wonder if Riot overlooks this intentionally because they aren't a governing body (except they kind of are when you consider that they are setting up a system of punishment, albeit an automated one that often makes mistakes) or if there is some internet legislation that doesn't require them to abide by American law even though they are an American company.  Granted this isn't unlawful, but it is a super scum-baggy practice
